qas.question: What does the Air Force provide for officers of direct to non-line positions?
What fields of study in the COT are included in this area of the USAF?

answers.text: medicine, law, religion, biological sciences, or healthcare administration

qas.question: What is an example of the coursework now offered in the COT in the USAF?

context: The Air Force also provides <a0_0>Commissioned Officer Training<a0_0/> (COT) for officers of all three components who are direct-commissioned to non-line positions due to their credentials in <a1_0>medicine, law, religion, biological sciences, or healthcare administration<a1_0/>. Originally viewed as a "knife and fork school" that covered little beyond basic wear of the uniform, COT in recent years has been fully integrated into the OTS program and today encompasses extensive coursework as well as field exercises in leadership, confidence, fitness, and <a2_0>deployed-environment operations<a2_0/>.
